page.title: 03MONYASH PLAYING FIELD
page.content: The new{Playing Field}in Monyash was opened on August 27th,1984.There are two sets of swings,a climbing frame, a see-saw and a slide on a mound. It is situated behind the{Hobbit Inn} on land rented from the owners of the pub. The Playing Field was built by a committee of local people at a total cost of Â£7,677.Two thirds of the money was obtained from an{E.E.C.Integrated {Rural Development Scheme}run by the {Peak District National Park.}There is a special safety surface of play-bark under the equipment which makes it particularly safe. The play ground is used alot by the villagers and visitors, especially in the summer.The children like the see-saw and climbing-frame best.They would like a roundabout but it is felt that these are too dangerous.
